title: Cap Streamers, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Mechlin style
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Cap streamers of Mechlin lace in a pattern showing a series of medallion compartments that are connected by volutes terminating in scrolls. Each medallion contains respectively: a winged cupid, prancing deer, a leaping rabbit set before a large tree and two architectural structures with a bird flying above, and a bird perched on a tree branch. Fond: drochel (Brussels mesh). Modes: fond de neige, portes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cap Streamers, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: linen
